column4: dano: I had to make some changes to my /etc/default/acpi-support file to get my suspend to work--have you messed with that yet?
don't know what settings to change
plus i thought ubuntu switched to pm-utils for a lot of the power management stuff
Did you ever make changes to that file when you were in gutsy to get your monitor to work OK?
no, it worked fine with no changes in feisty and gutsy
it initially worked in gutsy too, sort of
I was still using 915resolution at that point
But when i resumed the resolution was really low, and i read that 915resolution was obsolete with the new intel driver
So i removed it and regenerated my xorg.conf file, and thats when it stopped working
Well I'm still on Gutsy so I don't know about if Hardy switched to pm-utils or what, but if Hardy still uses that acpi-default file, I could give you some tips of what might help.
The key for me was changing "ACPI_SLEEP_MODE=mem" to "ACPI_SLEEP_MODE=standby" in that acpi-defaults file, I also did a few other tweaks or my sreensaver wouldn't work.
thanks, which file was that in again?
Let me know if it works, OK? :)
sure, will i have to reboot before the change takes effect?
Maybe some Ubuntu Guru here can tell you how to get around that, but yes, I had to reboot. :)
